meanings.definition: The act of monopolizing or gaining exclusive control over something.
meanings.sent1: The monopolizations of the local grocery stores led to limited choices for consumers.
meanings.sent2: In the business world, monopolizations can stifle competition and innovation.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's monopolizations of all the fish in the aquarium made the other animals jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her monopolizations of the conversation at the party made it hard for others to join in.
meanings.sent5: The monopolizations of power by the dictator created fear among the citizens.

meanings.definition: The process of dominating or controlling a market or industry.
meanings.sent1: The company's monopolizations in the tech sector gave them a significant advantage over competitors.
meanings.sent2: Global monopolizations can have far-reaching effects on the economy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's monopolizations of all the nuts in the park amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her monopolizations of the dance floor made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The monopolizations of the fashion industry by certain designers set the trends for the season.
